name: The Langham, Boston

reviews.title: Terrific location

reviews.text: The room is large and the bed comfortable. Their choice of coffee for the coffeemaker was gross but most of what we had in other hotels during our stay was too. Guess it must be our taste buds.

reviews.text: The swimming pool was great and all bar one day deserted.
We ate a couple of meals in the bar. The food was good and the service excellent. We were going to have brunch on Sunday but decided $50 per person was way too much and went elsewhere.

We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in July. As we are a family of four (inc 2 children) we booked a suite with 2 double beds. The first mistake was assuming that "double" meant "queen" - probably our mistake but other guests should bear this in mind as the beds were small.

likes.liked: — other than check-in staff, all the staff were friendly

reviews.text: We arrived at around 3pm as check-in is stated as "from 3pm". This was another mistake as check-in is at the discretion of the hotel from 3pm rather than meaning that the rooms are ready after 3pm. We stood in a long queue with other guests facing the same problem. The whole check-in became a sorry draw-out joke. The desk manager promised that the hotel manager would contact me once I complained but I never heard anything. I mentioned this when I checked out and again was told that the hotel manager would email me (which never happened).

reviews.text: This is an excellent hotel - the rooms are very well appointed although a bit small. The lobby is very nice, and the staff friendly and helpful. We got a great deal online.
The bad part - it is in a fairly dead part of Boston. If I were not here for a wedding, I would have never stayed there. It is a short 8-minute walk to Faneuil Hall, where the action starts.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was very pleasant, with all of the amenities you would expect at a 4*. The pool is fairly small, and the jazuzzi was crammed with children (on a Saturday evening) so that was a little dissapointing, especially as the signs clearly stated 'no children' and the member of staff choose to ignore the situation. The bar food was excellent, especially the freshly made pizzas available until midnight.

reviews.text: It is in a great location, where you can easily walk to the harbour, ferry tours and around the financial district of Boston. It is a short walk to the Faneuil Hall and Quincy market areas.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were supposed to have a superior room. We looked out over the roof air conditioners on the fifth floor - say you prefer not to have room 564. Otherwise, we had a great time; only five blocks from Quincy Market and a nice walk, close to Filene's Basement, Macy's. Ate at Saraceno in the North End and The Four Seasons Restaurant - both fabulous.
reviews.title: Langham Stay

reviews.text: I don't have anything specifically negative to say about the Langham, only that it failed to knock my socks off. I stayed here for 2 nights en route from California to London, so I was in transit somewhat and the hotel did provide me with what I needed - a quiet room, comfy bed. Good points: the staff were friendly, the swimming pool and whirlpool were very nice and Julien's the cocktail bar was beautiful. Also I asked for a DVD player and one was provided promptly, which impressed me. Not so good points: there's nothing really close by in terms of places to grab a snack or a soft drink - there's a 7 eleven the other side of the park but that's it really. The room service was extortionate - all of the wines were expensive but so was the food - way overpriced I thought, and I begrudge this. Its a nice hotel and a grand building but like I said, it didn't knock my socks off.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a parking lot adjacent to the Langham (One Post Office Square) but the pricing is not clearly listed. Langham offers 24-hour, in-and-out valet parking for $25, which in retrospect I think we should have gone with as our parking for a day and a half was $45.
reviews.title: High-class experience at the luxury Langham

reviews.text: One the biggest disappointments for me was the afternoon tea. I had never attended one before so thought this would be the perfect opportunity to do so. I emailed the hotel and received a reply that I should book well in advance. When I showed up, there were only 2 other people there and it didn't change the whole time I was there. In addition, it must have been between lunch and dinner because staff was changing the chairs at the tables around mine, making a lot of banging noises for what I think should have been a peaceful, quite experience.
reviews.title: nice hotel...but a few glitches that were annoying

likes.disliked: — wake up call came too early

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived at around 2pm we were told the room was not ready. This was fair enough as check in time was 3pm so we went & had lunch. When we returned an hour or so later we were told they were still cleaning the room. It subsequently transpired that some muppet had smoked in the room which was non-smoking. We hung around a bit longer & then suggested we go to the room to see just how bad it was( we have done this once before at another hotel when a similar situation arose). But were given a blunt "no" by a surly receptionist. We persisted but were told that housekeeping wouldn't let us. After I asked who ran the hotel housekeeping or the management they relented & took us to the room.The smoke smell was too much & by the time we got down to reception a lovely young lady had already juggled the bookings to give us the one next door. Why they did not do this in the first place I do not know. Alan who checked us in was extremely diplomatic but his sidekick on reception needs a lesson in customer relations. There was an indication that there would be a gesture of goodwill for our inconvenience. A bottle of wine would have been nice but when we checked out they even charged us the $2 for the access to two freephone nos. that we had dialled. A mark of any business is how they handle things when they go wrong. The Langham did not handle this well.
reviews.title: Just another big city hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you book a loft-suite be warned it's on the second floor so you get road noise plus the shrill pitch of the doormans whistle which at times can be constant & is intrusive & annoying. Additionally, at certain times of day first thing & late afternoon there was what sounded like furniture being dragged around on a hard floor above us. We checked upstairs but was just a room which would have been carpeted so we never did fathom what all that was about. Finally, & this applies to all hotels - why are they so mean with tea bags. They waste money changing soap, toilet rolls etc. daily but only leave you two teabags.

Stayed here last weekend after a gruelling week on a course. Thought hotel was wonderful - the bedroom was large and the bed extremely comfortable. Also enjoyed the swimming pool and fitness suite. Less than 10 minutes walk to Macy's and (in the other direction) to Faneuil Hall - so very convenient. Wonderful - would certainly come here again.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.text: Visited Boston at the end of September and stayed at the Langham for 3 nights. The hotel is centrally located to all of the sites. Upon check-in we were given an upgrade to a superior room. Our room was large and very nicely appointed. Very comfortable beds and special kudos to the high quality towels. Overall we found the hotel to be upscale but not stuffy. We would definately stay here again.

description: Housed in a famous architectural landmark, The Langham, Boston offers a unique blend of history, charm and urban sophistication. The hotel is in Boston's financial district and within a 5 min walk to Faneuil Hall Marketplace. It is also steps away from the Boston Harbor, the North End, Boston's finest shopping district, major colleges and universities, theaters, and the Freedom Trail to name a few. The Langham, Boston is ideally located for both business and pleasure and offers three delectable dining options,the Reserve, a refined champagne lounge which serves a continental breakfast selection and offers dining from dawn until dusk with a menu featuring soups, salads and light entrees, along with beer, wine and champagne and the Langham's traditional British Tiffin Afternoon Tea. Bond is a premiere destination for cosmopolitan dining, cocktails and entertainment. Cafe Fleuri offers contemporary New England cuisine for full breakfast and Lunch (mon-fri)and our decadent Saturday Chocolate Bar and renowned Sunday Brunch. All guests at the Langham Hotel enjoy our signature Langham Turn Down service, plush robes and slippers, and full complimentary use of the fitness center and indoor heated pool and jacuzzi in our charming and intimate pool pavilion.
